definition: to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive

sentences.english: She has an account at that store.
He bought the car on credit.
sentences.chinese: 他赊帐买了这部小汽车。

sentences.english: Have another coffee. We have credit here.
sentences.chinese: 再喝一杯咖啡吧，我们在这儿可以赊帐。

sentences.english: A. Yes. Subject to credit approval, of course.
sentences.chinese: 好，当然是在经过赊帐批准后。

sentences.english: The whole island lives on credit.
sentences.chinese: 全岛的人都靠赊帐度日。

sentences.english: He can't buy anything more on credit until he settles his old bills up.
sentences.chinese: 除非他把旧帐付清，否则他不能赊帐购买任何东西。

sentences.english: Everyone keeps offering me credit in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，大家总想让我赊帐。

sentences.english: You can purchase this TV set on credit.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用赊帐的方式购买这台电视机。

definition: to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive
to buy on credit/to delay payment
to write an IOU or promissory note
room charge in a hotel/accommodation expenses
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
